reviews.text: Cute little breakfast nook - a little packed, but well worth the trip. Had the creamed chipped beef and was impressed. Coffee was good and refills were plentiful. Servers were kind and attentive. My date had the Captain Crunch French Toast and enjoyed it very much. Happy we stopped in!

Food was incredible  , just loved the Capt crunch french toast w/ fruit.  I would go back in a second , this  place could  be bigger.  We were lucky not much of a wait  , but folks after us waited about the whole time we were there. It also feels like you are sitting on top of the next person.  Just to put this out there , if you have little kids , the language is not kid suitable if that is a concern to your family.
No wait time considering they had a party with 3 tables. Easy to see from the street. Trendy crowd. Small tables. Beautiful art. Great service.
We love this spot! Quaint place, filling food, and easy service. Definitely worth the visit and wait.

45 minutes wait for breakfast!  I am not addicted to food but we had time so we walked around. Food was good. Keep your expectations reasonable. Sweet Baby Jesus is their speciality. It was good but why that name!  When I was paying the bill at the counter,the staff was laughing as someone on our table was overdressed for their location and asked the server if they served any alcoholic drinks. None of that bothers me, but I can see it bothering people who are little sensitive about such stuff. 
My advice is if they seat you quickly go for it. It’s not worth 45 minutes waiting. Nothing ever is!!
